item.title: Esperanto
item.description:
Grammar

![][https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M-TioyqRO9o]

Summary:

  • SVO Structure
    • Objects marked with -n, the accusative case
  • Nouns marked with -o
  • Adjectives marked with -a
  • One article, la
    • La is definite, or ’the'
      • “Mi havas la libro” -> I have the book
    • There is no indefinite article
      • “Mi havas libro” -> I have a book
  • Plurality is marked with -j, similar to the English -s
  • Adverbs marked with -e
    • -e can also mean “In the”
      • “Urbo” -> City
      • “Urbe” -> In the city
  • Conjugation
    • Infinitive -> -i
    • Past -> -is
    • Present -> -as
    • Future -> -os
    • Conditional -> -us
    • Imperative -> -u
  • Adjectives usually before noun

Pronouns

item.title: Posting
item.description: I am planning to add this folder to my GitHub Pages at easyonhard.github.io. I am planning on using it to host information for friends and for a passion project. My plan is to markdown write here, transcode it to HTML in Hugo, and then push it to GitHub. Shouldn’t be that mad.
